PROMPTSETXUI.XUIEDITOR:
<dialog height="506" icon="PRPT" id="PRPTS" left="279" top="4" width="420"><readpanel fill="b" id="PRPTBOX" nl="1" scroll="v" text="Parameters"><properties><entry name="text">Parameters</entry><entry name="modifiable">0</entry></properties><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_DEVICEs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Source Device" tooltip="Specifies where the installation media can be found. This can be a hardware device such as tape or diskette, it can be a directory that contains installation images, or it can be the installation image file itself. When the installation media is a product tape or Corrective Service tape, specified the tape device as no-rewindon- close and no-retension-on-open. Examples of this would be /dev/rmt0.1 for a high density tape, or/dev/rmt0.5 for a low density tape. Use the options specified by the tape supplier. The default device is /dev/rfd0. If parameter not empty, the option "-d" is used at command line." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Source Device</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_DEVICEs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Specifies where the installation media can be
found. This can be a hardware device such as
tape or diskette, it can be a directory that contains
installation images, or it can be the installation
image file itself. When the installation
media is a product tape or Corrective Service
tape, specified the tape device as no-rewindon-
close and no-retension-on-open. Examples
of this would be /dev/rmt0.1 for a high density
tape, or/dev/rmt0.5 for a low density tape. Use
the options specified by the tape supplier. The
default device is /dev/rfd0. If parameter not
empty, the option "-d" is
used at command line.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_FILESET_NAMEs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Fileset name" tooltip="This is the name of the software product to be installed and can specify either an entire software product or any separately installable filesets within the software product. This can be used to specify the name of a fileset or fileset update." upper="0" required="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Fileset name</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_FILESET_NAMEs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">This is the name of the software product to be installed and can specify either an entire software product or any separately installable filesets within the software product. This can be used to specify the name of a fileset or fileset update.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_FILESET_LEVELs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Fileset level" tooltip="This indicates the level of the software product or update that is to be installed and is of the form vv.rr.mmmm.ffff. If a fileset update has an additional fix ID (also know as ptf id), that ID must also be specified in the Level as in vv.rr.mmmm.ffff.ppppppp" upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Fileset level</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_FILESET_LEVELs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">This indicates the level of the software product or update that is to be installed and is of the form vv.rr.mmmm.ffff. If a fileset update has an additional fix ID (also know as ptf id), that ID must also be specified in the Level as in vv.rr.mmmm.ffff.ppppppp</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_FILESET_LISTFILEs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Fileset list from file" tooltip="Reads the names of the software products from a list file defined in this parameter. Software fileset names, optionally followed by a level, should be one per line of text, and any text following the second set of white spaces or tabs on a line is ignored. Output from the installp -l command is suitable for input to this flag. Uses the option "-f" at command line, if parameter not empty." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Fileset list from file</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_FILESET_LISTFILEs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Reads the names of the software products
from a list file defined in this parameter. Software fileset names, optionally
followed by a level, should be one per line of
text, and any text following the second set of
white spaces or tabs on a line is ignored. Output
from the installp -l command is suitable for
input to this flag. Uses the option "-f" at command
line, if parameter not empty.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SUPR_FILESET_WCARDs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Supress fileset wildcard" tooltip="Does not wildcard the fileset name defined in this parameter. Use this flag from smit so it only installs the fileset chosen and not the filesets that match. For example, if you choose foo.rte, foo.rte.bar is not automatically pulled in, as it would be by default, without setting this parameter to 'yes' Uses the option "-w" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Supress fileset wildcard</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SUPR_FILESET_WCARDs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Does not wildcard the fileset name defined in this parameter. Use this flag
from smit so it only installs the fileset chosen
and not the filesets that match. For example, if
you choose foo.rte, foo.rte.bar is not automatically
pulled in, as it would be by default,
without setting this parameter to 'yes' Uses
the option "-w" at command line if parameter
set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_FAIL_IF_INSTALLEDs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Fail if installed" tooltip="If set to 'yes', the runbook function fails if the package with the same version is already installed." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Fail if installed</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_FAIL_IF_INSTALLEDs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">If set to 'yes', the runbook function fails if the package with the same version is already installed.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_ALLOW_DOWNGRADEs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Allow downgrade install" tooltip="This option can be used to force the installation of a software product even if there exists a previously installed version of the software product that is the same as or newer than the version currently being installed. The -F flag is not valid with update packages or the parameter 'Install/update dependencies"='yes' flag. When you use this flag, the parameter 'Limit to base level filesets'='yes' is implicit. Uses the option "-F" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Allow downgrade install</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_ALLOW_DOWNGRADEs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">This option can be used to force the installation of a software product even if there exists a previously installed version of the software product that is the same as or newer than the version currently being installed. The -F flag is not valid with update packages or the parameter 'Install/update dependencies"='yes' flag. When you use this flag, the parameter 'Limit to base level filesets'='yes' is implicit.
Uses the option "-F" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_WITH_COMMITs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="With commit" tooltip="Commits all specified updates that are currently applied but not committed. When an update is committed all other software products it is dependent on must also be committed (unless they are already in the committed state). The specified software product is dependent on any software product that is a prerequisite or corequisite of the specified product. If the requisite software products are not in the committed state, the commit fails and error messages are displayed. The 'Install/Update dependencies' parameter can be used to automatically commit requisite software product updates. Uses the option "-c" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">With commit</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_WITH_COMMITs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Commits all specified updates that are currently applied but not committed. When an update is committed all other software products it is dependent on must also be committed (unless they are already in the committed state). The specified software product is dependent on any software product that is a prerequisite or corequisite of the specified product. If the requisite software products are not in the committed state, the commit fails and error messages are displayed. The 'Install/Update dependencies' parameter can be used to automatically commit requisite software product updates.
Uses the option "-c" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_AGREE_LICENSES" nl="1" quotes="" text="Agree software licenses" tooltip="Agrees to required software license agreements for software to be installed. Uses the option "-Y" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Agree software licenses</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_AGREE_LICENSES</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Agrees to required software license agreements for software to be installed.
Uses the option "-Y" at command line if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_LOG_FILEs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Log file" tooltip="Enables event logging. The parameter enables the user to append certain parts of the installp command output to the log file specified by this parameter. By default the output of the installp command goes to stdout and stderr, unless SMIT or VSM is used, in which case the output goes to the smit.log. Thia parameter must specify an existing, writable file, and the file system in which the file resides must have enough space to store the log. The log file does not wrap. Uses the option "-e" at command line, if parameter not empty. " upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Log file</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_LOG_FILEs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Enables event logging. The parameter enables
the user to append certain parts of the installp
command output to the log file specified by this parameter. By default
the output of the installp command goes to
stdout and stderr, unless SMIT or VSM is
used, in which case the output goes to the
smit.log. Thia parameter must specify an existing, writable file,
and the file system in which the file resides
must have enough space to store the log. The
log file does not wrap. Uses the option "-e" at command line, if
parameter not empty.
</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><integer enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_DEBUG_LEVELs.00" max="" min="" nl="1" text="Debug level" tooltip="Specifies the verbose option that provides four levels of detail for preinstallation output. The valid values for the parameter are 2, 3, or 4. The default level of verbosity, without the use of the -V flag, prints an alphabetically ordered list of FAILURES, WARNINGS, and SUCCESSES from preinstallation processing. Requisite failures are reported with emphasis on the real cause of the failure. Extraneous requisites for failed filesets are not displayed. The preinstallation output is modified by levels 2 through 4 as described below: 2: Prints alphabetically ordered list of FAILURES and WARNINGS. Requisite failures are displayed with additional information describing requisite relationships between selected filesets and the requisites causing them to fail. Failing requisites suppressed under Level 1 are displayed. Preinstallation SUCCESSES are displayed in the order in which they are processed. 3: Level 3 is the same as Level 2, with the exception that additional requisite information is displayed for SUCCESSES. 4: Level 4 is the same as Level 3 for SUCCESSES and WARNINGS. Requisite failures are displayed in a format depicting detailed requisite relationships. Note: If verbosity level 2 or higher is used, the files that are restored on to the system is shown in the output. Because this will make installp's output much more verbose, make sure that your / (root) filesystem does not become full when the /smit.log becomes large (if using smit to run installp). Uses the option "-V#" at command line, if not -1." alt="1"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_NUMERIC</entry><entry name="text">Debug level</entry><entry name="min"/><entry name="max"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_DEBUG_LEVELs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Specifies the verbose option that provides four
levels of detail for preinstallation output. The
valid values for the parameter are 2, 3, or 4. The default
level of verbosity, without the use of the -V
flag, prints an alphabetically ordered list of
FAILURES, WARNINGS, and SUCCESSES
from preinstallation processing. Requisite failures
are reported with emphasis on the real
cause of the failure. Extraneous requisites for
failed filesets are not displayed. The preinstallation
output is modified by levels 2
through 4 as described below: 2: Prints alphabetically
ordered list of FAILURES and
WARNINGS. Requisite failures are displayed
with additional information describing requisite
relationships between selected filesets and
the requisites causing them to fail. Failing requisites
suppressed under Level 1 are displayed.
Preinstallation SUCCESSES are
displayed in the order in which they are processed.
3: Level 3 is the same as Level 2, with
the exception that additional requisite information
is displayed for SUCCESSES. 4:
Level 4 is the same as Level 3 for SUCCESSES
and WARNINGS. Requisite failures
are displayed in a format depicting detailed requisite
relationships. Note: If verbosity level 2
or higher is used, the files that are restored on
to the system is shown in the output. Because
this will make installp's output much more verbose,
make sure that your / (root) filesystem
does not become full when the /smit.log
becomes large (if using smit to run installp).
Uses the option "-V#" at command line, if not -1.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue">0</entry></properties></integer><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_PREVENT_BOSBOOTs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Prevent performing bosboot" tooltip="Prevents the system from performing a bosboot in the event that one is needed. Uses the option "-b" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Prevent performing bosboot</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_PREVENT_BOSBOOTs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Prevents the system from performing a bosboot in the event that one is needed.
Uses the option "-b" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_UPDATES_ONLYs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Updates only" tooltip="Indicates that the requested action should be limited to software updates. Uses the option "-B" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Updates only</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_UPDATES_ONLYs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Indicates that the requested action should be limited to software updates.
Uses the option "-B" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_DELETE_AFTER_INSTALLs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Delete installation image after install" tooltip="Deletes the installation image file after the software product or update has been successfully installed. When the 'Install/Update dependencies'='yes' flag is specified, the installation image files for any products that are automatically included are also eleted. This flag is not valid with the 'Install only specified parts'='root' flag. This flag is also only valid when the device is a directory and an installation image file on the system where the installation is taking place. Uses the option "-D" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Delete installation image after install</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_DELETE_AFTER_INSTALLs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Deletes the installation image file after the software product or update has been successfully installed. When the 'Install/Update dependencies'='yes' flag is specified, the installation image files for any products that are automatically included are also eleted. This flag is not valid with the 'Install only specified parts'='root' flag. This flag is also only valid when the device is a directory and an installation image file on the system where the installation is taking place.
Uses the option "-D" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_LIMIT_TO_BASE_LEVELs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Limit to base level filesets" tooltip="Indicates that the requested action must be limited to base level filesets. Uses the option "-I" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Limit to base level filesets</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_LIMIT_TO_BASE_LEVELs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Indicates that the requested action must be limited to base level filesets.
Uses the option "-I" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_INSTALL_DEPSs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Install/update dependencies" tooltip="When used to install or commit, this flag automatically installs or commits, respectively, any software products or updates that are requisites of the specified software product. Uses the option "-g" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Install/update dependencies</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_INSTALL_DEPSs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">When used to install or commit, this flag automatically installs or commits, respectively, any software products or updates that are requisites of the specified software product.
Uses the option "-g" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SUPR_FAILING_PREREQs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Supress failing installation requisites" tooltip="Suppresses errors and warnings concerning products failing to install due to instrequisites. Uses the option "-Q" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Supress failing installation requisites</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SUPR_FAILING_PREREQs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Suppresses errors and warnings concerning products failing to install due to instrequisites.
Uses the option "-Q" at command line, if parameter set to 'yes'.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dyncheckgroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_INST_ONLY_PARTSs.00" mode="list" nl="1" quotes="" required="0" separator=";" text="Installs only specified parts" tooltip="Installs the specified part of the software product. You can multi-select the following options: root: indicates the / (root) part is to be installed (at command line r is used together with the option -O) /usr/share: indicates the /usr/share part is to be installed (at command line s is used together with the option -O) /usr/: indicates the /usr part is to be installed (at command line u is used together with the option -O) The parameter is not needed with standard systems because without this flag all parts are installed by default. This flag is needed for use with the installation of diskless or dataless workstations and is designed for use by thenim command. The option root only is not valid with the 'Source device' or 'Limit to base level filesets' parameters." alt="1"><properties><entry listparam="C,N" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.AUTOMIC_AIX.PRV.VARA.INSTALL_PARTS</entry><entry name="text">Installs only specified parts</entry><entry alias="multiselect" name="cgmultiselect">1</entry><entry alias="separator" name="cgseparator">;</entry><entry alias="haslist" name="cghaslist">0</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_INST_ONLY_PARTSs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Installs the specified part of the software product. You can multi-select the following options:
root: indicates the / (root) part is to be installed (at command line r is used together with the option -O)
/usr/share: indicates the /usr/share part is to be installed (at command line s is used together with the option -O)
/usr/: indicates the /usr part is to be installed (at command line u is used together with the option -O)
The parameter is not needed with standard systems because without this flag all parts are installed by default. This flag is needed for use with the installation of diskless or dataless workstations and is designed for use by thenim command. The option root only is not valid with the 'Source device' or 'Limit to base level filesets' parameters.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></dyncheckgroup><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SAVE_DIRs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Save directory" tooltip="Specifies an alternate save directory location for files being replaced by an update. This parameter is useful when there is insufficient space in the default file systems (/ and /usr) or when it is undesirable to permanently expand these file systems. It may be desirable for the specified directory to be a remote file system. A remote file system must have ample space, because the installp command cannot expand remote file systems. Uses the option "-t" at command line, if parameter not empty. " upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Save directory</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SAVE_DIRs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Specifies an alternate save directory location
for files being replaced by an update. This
parameter is useful when there is insufficient
space in the default file systems (/ and /usr) or when it is undesirable to permanently expand
these file systems. It may be desirable for the
specified directory to be a remote file system.
A remote file system must have ample space,
because the installp command cannot expand
remote file systems. Uses the option "-t" at command line, if
parameter not empty.
</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_VERIFYs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Verify installed files" tooltip="Verifies that all installed files in the fileset have the correct checksum value after the installation. Installed files are always verified for correct file size after installation. Use this flag after network or remote device installations. If any errors are reported, it might be necessary to install the software product again. Post-installation requisite consistency checks are also started by this flag. Uses the option "-v" at command line, if parameter not empty." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Verify installed files</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_VERIFYs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Verifies that all installed files in the fileset have the correct checksum value after the installation. Installed files are always verified for correct file size after installation. Use this flag after network or remote device installations. If any errors are reported, it might be necessary to install the software product again. Post-installation requisite consistency checks are also started by this flag.
Uses the option "-v" at command line, if parameter not empty.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_AUTO_EXPANDs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Auto-expand file systems" tooltip="Attempts to expand any file systems where there is insufficient space to do the installation. This option expands file systems based on current available space and size estimates that are provided by the software product package. Note that it is possible to exhaust available disk space during an installation even if this flag is specified, especially if other files are being created or expanded in the same file systems during an installation. Also note that any remote file systems cannot be expanded. Uses the option "-X" at command line, if parameter not empty." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Auto-expand file systems</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_AUTO_EXPANDs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Attempts to expand any file systems where there is insufficient space to do the installation. This option expands file systems based on current available space and size estimates that are provided by the software product package. Note that it is possible to exhaust available disk space during an installation even if this flag is specified, especially if other files are being created or expanded in the same file systems during an installation. Also note that any remote file systems cannot be expanded.
Uses the option "-X" at command line, if parameter not empty.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_PREVIEW_ONLYs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Preview only" tooltip="Performs a preview of an action by running all preinstallation checks for the specified action. Uses the option "-p" at command line, if parameter not empty." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Preview only</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_PREVIEW_ONLYs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Performs a preview of an action by running all preinstallation checks for the specified action.
Uses the option "-p" at command line, if parameter not empty.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/></properties></dynradiogroup><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SUDO_PASSWORDs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="1" text="Sudo password" tooltip="Sudo password." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Sudo password</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SUDO_PASSWORDs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">1</entry><entry name="tooltip">Sudo password.</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text></readpanel></dialog>
